0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Cardiac blood pool imaging: 370 to 740 megabecquerels (10 to 20 millicuries) IV
  • Isotope study for gastrointestinal blood loss: 370 to 740 megabecquerels (10 to 20 millicuries) IV

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and efficacy have not been established in children

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Cardiac blood pool imaging
  • Isotope study for gastrointestinal blood loss

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• blood borne pathogen transmission potential; implement procedures to avoid administration errors and vial contamination of personnel
  • radiopharmaceutical; handle with care and use safety measures to reduce radiation exposure to personnel and patient
  • labeled red blood cells should be administered within 30 minutes of preparation or as soon as possible

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono:
• AAP: Radioactive compounds that require temporary cessation of breastfeeding.
  • Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Technetium Tc 99m red blood cells distributes into the blood pool thereby enabling radiographic imaging

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Injection, intravenous
  • use proper procedures for handling and disposal of radiopharmaceuticals
  • maintain appropriate shielding throughout the preparation process and for the life of the compound to minimize radiation exposure
  • wear waterproof gloves during the handling procedure
  • heparin or Anticoagulant Citrate Dextrose Solution (ACD) should be used for anticoagulation; do not use EDTA Oxalate
  • add 1 to 3 mL of anticoagulated whole blood to the reaction vial; allow to react for 5 minutes; add contents of Syringe I, mix gently by inverting 4 to 5 times then add contents of Syringe II to the reaction vial and mix gently inverting 4 to 5 times
  • add 370 to 3700 megabecquerels (10 to 100 millicuries) sodium pertechnetate Tc 99m to the reaction vial; allow to react for 20 minutes.
  • use largest bore needle compatible with patient administration to prevent hemolysis
  • measure dose with a suitable radioactivity calibration system just prior to administration
  • technetium Tc 99m labeled red blood cells should be injected within 30 minutes of preparation

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: visualization for blood pool imaging indicates efficacy
